meanings.definition: Transfer or delegate (power) to a lower level, especially from central government to local or regional administration.
meanings.sent1: The mayor is devolving authority to the neighborhood councils.
meanings.sent2: The decision to devolve more responsibilities to the provinces was welcomed.
meanings.sent3: The king joked that he was devolving his royal duties to his pet cat.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's strict rules were devolving into chaos as the students rebelled.
meanings.sent5: The transfer of power was like devolving a heavy burden onto the shoulders of the local leaders.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old building was devolving into a state of disrepair.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful protest started to devolve into a chaotic situation.
meanings.sent3: The once beautiful garden was slowly devolving into a wild jungle.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was devolving into constant arguments and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful silence devolved into a loud, disruptive commotion.

meanings.definition: Pass down or be passed down from one generation to another.
meanings.sent1: The family heirloom was devolved to the youngest daughter.
meanings.sent2: Traditions are devolved from parents to children in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: The ancient recipe was devolved through the generations, unchanged.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the elders was devolving to the youth of the village.
meanings.sent5: The stories of bravery were devolved from grandfather to grandson, inspiring each generation.
